Class ImageProcessing

java.lang.Object
ImageProcessing
public class ImageProcessing extends Object

Image Processing Class

This class processes the image according to various parameters.It scales the image to the default value of side which is 48 pixels. then it converts the image into grayscale BufferedImage. Otherwise if side is given while instantiating an object the image will be scaled according to that.
Author:
harshjohar

    ImageProcessing(String filePath, int side)
    The constructor sets side to value passed in int side, after that it reads the BufferedImage and scales it to side pixels and converts it into grayscale format.

  • Constructor Details

    • ImageProcessing

      public ImageProcessing(String filePath) throws IOException
      The constructor sets side to default value i.e. 48 pixels, after that it reads the BufferedImage and scales it to 48 pixels and converts it into grayscale format.
      Parameters:
      filePath - Path to the image. This parameter accepts a String that is the path to an image formats supported by ImageIO.read(URL).
      Throws:
      IOException - Exceptions that might occur.
      See Also:
      • ImageProcessing(String, int)
      • BufferedImage
      • IOException

    • ImageProcessing

      public ImageProcessing(String filePath, int side) throws IOException
      The constructor sets side to value passed in int side, after that it reads the BufferedImage and scales it to side pixels and converts it into grayscale format.
      Parameters:
      filePath - This parameter accepts a String that is the path to an Image supported by ImageIO.read(URL).
      side - This parameter sets the value of the global variable private int side. It represents the number of pixels the image will be scaled to.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exceptions that might occur while reading the image.
      See Also:
      • ImageProcessing(String)
      • BufferedImage
      • IOException

  • Method Details

    • getSide

      public int getSide()
      Returns:
      The number of pixels associated with the BufferedImage of the object.

    • getImage

      public BufferedImage getImage()
      Returns:
      Processed BufferedImage linked with ImageProcessing object.
